Description: Rim sherd (mended from two fragments) of Chian, possibly Mature Animal Style or Grand Style, pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; two added white bands at centre of sherd and trace of third at bottom; exterior: band of billets below rim; painted decoration consisting of frontal owl resting on a tendril; below, single brown line.
Curator's comments: Lemos places this sherd in the Grand Style. Owls are generally rare in Chian pottery and this one has been interpreted by Walter-Karydi as being associated with Athena. It ought to be mentioned that rim pattern on the sherd is not typical of the Grand Style and the interior decoration is much more simplistic than the usual decoration found on the interior of Grand Style vases.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 106-7, fig. 59, p. 273, no. 711, pl. I, pl. 93)
Johnston 1978 / Pottery from Naukratis: An Exhibition on the Occasion of the 11th International Congress of Classical Archaeology (no. 69) (Incorrectly labelled 1886.6-1.491)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0651) (phase 2)
